content:
I've used r? rust-lang/compiler-team to re-roll for a new reviewer in the past but that no longer seems to work. I've also tried r? compiler-team but that doesn't work either.

What's the current way to re-roll for a new reviewer?
hm, can you point me to as recent a failure case as you can?
I can try to look at logs
I suspect it's just broken
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/91150#issuecomment-1012557799 and the subsequent comment
huh, we appear to have zero logs for 14 hours yesterday (6am to 8pm my time)
Let me try again. Perhaps the bot was just down or something?
Oh, you just did :smile:
well, no, github says the webhook was delivered and we got a response...
This topic was moved here from #t-compiler/help > highfive reviewer re-roll by simulacrum
I restarted highfive, but looking at the code there's a number of paths that have zero logging on them right now
Thanks for looking into it!
going to try and see if there's a test already for this and maybe debug that way
huh, well, running tests I seem to hit https://stackoverflow.com/questions/50504500/deprecationwarning-invalid-escape-sequence-what-to-use-instead-of-d which is fun (with different letters, though)
ok, I think I know what happened
it looks like there's a missing ? after @ in the non-group regex
but that won't by itself fix it, since it looks like we only run the pick-reviewer code on the proper match code
https://github.com/rust-lang/highfive/blob/601816f4822ba2bbedf239de146ab3c1b0c10bf0/highfive/newpr.py#L261
I suspect https://github.com/rust-lang/highfive/pull/350 is the regression
ok, I think I have a fix
hm, actually, let me try to figure out why the rust-lang/compiler-team didn't work
oh, looks like that may have been just a transient error
@Wesley Wiser ok, https://github.com/rust-lang/highfive/pull/377 should make this work in the future
bit hacky -- allows @bar/@foo to mean equivalent of @bar/foo but seems OK.
